title: Concave Meets Convex In the New OneUp Wave Pedals
content:
A concave pedal adds grip by locking your feet into position, but can make it hard for them to re-position. A convex or totally flat pedal leaves you more mobile, but less secure. So, what would happen if you combined the two? Well, the OneUp Wave pedals would happen. Behind the spindle, the pedal surface is flat. In front of the spindle, it has a gentle scoop…

According to OneUp, the concave front half “holds your foot securely in place when descending and stops your shoe from sliding forward. The raised front also makes it easier to readjust your foot without taking your shoe off the pedal completely.” And meanwhile, “the back half of the pedal is sloped to promote an aggressive heels-down foot position for more power and control. This new profile keeps your feet in place without solely relying on longer, sharper pins.” To accompany the heels-down design, the pins are angled forward, so they’re oriented more vertically while riding.

Specs:

  • Weight: 355g (Pair)
  • Thickness: Axle 14.2mm / Edges 11.5mm
  • Size: 107mm x 110mm (W x L)
  • Bearing configuration: Inboard igus™ Bushing and 3x outboard cartridge bearings
  • Body: Forged and CNC’d 6061 Aluminum Body
  • Axle: Chromoly Steel with Black ED coating
  • Pins: M4 Hollow Pin 10 x pins per side (self-cleaning hex through hole)
  • Colors: Black, Red, Dark Green, Dark Blue, Orange, Purple, Grey, Bronze

The OneUp Wave Pedals have been in development since early 2022, having gone through several iterations until its release more than three years later. OneUp is known for successfully sweating the small stuff, with innovative handlebars, tools, and of course, dropper posts. But we’re still a bit skeptical. We’ve got a pair coming in for review, so stay tuned for our verdict this summer.
